availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William E. Minor (Nelson County, KY, farmer, soldier (CSA) and prov govt conv rep)

body.p: Nelson County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of William Minor. Student in Nelson County in 1850. Household owned twenty-five enslaved persons in Nelson County in 1850. Farmer in Nelson County in 1860. Member of the convention of the provisional government held at Russellville in November 1861. Served in the 6th Regiment Infantry, Kentucky Volunteers (C.S.A.) as private from October 8, 1861. Served in the Orphan Brigade. Prisoner of war at Camp Chase, Ohio until May 18, 1865.

ab.bibl:

Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Nelson County,Bloomfield, p. 89A.

Papers of and Relating to Military and Civilian Personnel, compiled 1874 - 1899,
documenting the period 1861 - 1865. NARA RG 109, Publication M347, Roll 0276.
